net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Class StreamCon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamCon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionI, StreamConI, MsgParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileCon, StreamConReader

    public class StreamCon
extends java.lang.Object
implements StreamConI
    StreamCon is implementation of ConnectionI that is backed by streams. Messages are sent and received through InputStream and OutputStream objects.

    Messages are sent over the InputStream when sendMsg(MarkupMsg) is called. When pollNextMsg() is called, it polls from the message queue. If the message queue is empty, the OutputStream is checked for any new data.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    InputStream, OutputStream

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean shouldBlockForInput
      when true and when the message queue is empty, calling pollNextMsg or isMsgAvailable will block until a new message is received on the InputStream.

      Constructs a connection that is backed by IO streams.
      StreamCon(java.io.OutputStream out, long id)
      Constructs a new StreamCon connection with receiving messages disabled.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamCon

        public StreamCon(java.io.InputStream in,
         java.io.OutputStream out,
         long id)
        Constructs a connection that is backed by IO streams. Both sending and receiving messages is enabled when both an InputStream and OutputStream are given.
        Parameters:
        in - Stream that messages will be sent on. Must not be null.
        out - Stream that messages are received from. Must not be null
        id - value that will be returned when getId() is called
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if in or out is null.

      • StreamCon

        public StreamCon(java.io.InputStream in,
         long id)
        Constructs a new StreamCon connection with sending messages disabled. Only receiving messages is enabled.
        Parameters:
        in - stream to receive messages on. Must not be null.
        id - value that will be returned by getId().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if in is null

      • StreamCon

        public StreamCon(java.io.OutputStream out,
         long id)
        Constructs a new StreamCon connection with receiving messages disabled. Only sending messages is enabled.
        Parameters:
        out - stream to send messages on. Must not be null.
        id - value that will be returned by getId().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if out is null

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageDelimeter

        public char getMessageDelimeter()
        Gets the character that distinguishes the start and end of different messages. If a message contains this character, the message will not be properly parsed. This is usually a new line character, but can be any character.
        Returns:
        character that separates different messages

      • setMessageDelimeter

        public void setMessageDelimeter(char delimeter)
        Sets the character that distinguishes the start and end of different messages. If a message contains this character, the message will not be properly parsed. This is usually a new line character, but can be any character.
        Parameters:
        delimeter - the new character that will be used to seperate messages

      • reachedEndOfInput

        public boolean reachedEndOfInput()
        Indicates if the end of the input stream was reached.
        Returns:
        true if the end of stream was reached.

      • isReceivingSupported

        public boolean isReceivingSupported()
        Indicates if receiving messages is supported. Receiving messages is supported if an InputStream was passed into the constructor.
        Returns:
        true if messages can be received

      • isSendingSupported

        public boolean isSendingSupported()
        Indicates if sending messages is supported. Sending messages is supported if an OutputStream was passed into the constructor.
        Returns:
        true if messages can be sent

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Each connection has a unique id that allows others to distinguish between connections
        Specified by:
        getId in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        the unique id associated with this connection

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Returns whether the connection has been closed.

        If the connection is closed, the connection should no longer be used. Be aware, this method can return true even though close() was never called.

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface StreamConI
        Returns:
        true if the connection is closed, false otherwise.

      • pollNextMsg

        public MarkupMsg pollNextMsg()
        Returns the next message in the queue. If the queue is empty, the input stream is checked for new data.
        Specified by:
        pollNextMsg in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        the next available MarkupMsg or null if there are no messages to poll
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if receiving messages is not supported

      • isMsgAvailable

        public boolean isMsgAvailable()
        Checks if the received messages queue is not empty. If it is empty, the input stream is checked for new data.
        Specified by:
        isMsgAvailable in interface ConnectionI
        Returns:
        true if a message can be polled by pollNextMsg()
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if receiving messages is not supported

      • sendMsg

        public boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg message)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionI
        Sends a MarkupMsg. Depending on the implementing class, the message could be set across a TCP stream, file stream, or some other medium.

        Implementations are free to determine how to send messages. The protocol for sending messages is also defined by the implementation.

        Specified by:
        sendMsg in interface ConnectionI
        Parameters:
        message - message to send across the connection
        Returns:
        true if the sending the message was successful, false otherwise. It does not guarantee that the message was received.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if sending messages is not supported

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Flushes the connection's output buffer. Not all connections buffer their outgoing messages so calling flush on some implementations will do nothing.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface StreamConI
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if sending messages is not supported

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Closes the connection, releasing any system resources. Once a connection has been closed, it should no longer be used.
        Specified by:
        close in interface StreamConI

      • addMsgToQueue

        protected boolean addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg msg)
        Adds a message to the received messages queue. The added messages can be read by calling pollNextMsg()
        Parameters:
        msg - message to add to the received message queue
        Returns:
        This method never fails at adding the message and will always return true.

      • handleRawInput

        protected void handleRawInput(java.lang.String input)
        Called when a raw message has been read from the input stream. The method then parses the string into a MarkupMsg object and adds it the message queue. The new message can be read by calling pollNextMsg().
        Parameters:
        input - string containing the contents of the MarkupMsg. The input argument can be null if the end of stream was reached.

      • attemptToReadRawMessage

        protected boolean attemptToReadRawMessage()
        Attempts to read an entire MarkupMsg object in it's raw, String form. If does read the entire raw MarkupMsg object, it calls handleRawInput(String).
        Returns:
        true if an entire raw MarkupMsg object was read

      • setParser

        public void setParser(MsgParser parser)
        Description copied from interface: MsgParsable
        Sets the parser that should be used by the implementation to parse the raw input into a MarkupMsg object and to convert a MarkupMsg object to it's raw form.
        Specified by:
        setParser in interface MsgParsable
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to use

      • getParser

        public MsgParser getParser()
        Description copied from interface: MsgParsable
        Returns the parser that is being used by the implementation
        Specified by:
        getParser in interface MsgParsable
        Returns:
        the parser that is being used to parse input into MarkupMsg objects.
